case_vignette: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency department with general weakness and fatigue. He states that he has not felt well for several days and can't take care of himself anymore due to fatigue. The patient has a past medical history of IV drug abuse, alcohol abuse, and multiple minor traumas associated with intoxication. His temperature is 104°F (40°C), blood pressure is 127/68 mmHg, pulse is 120/min, respirations are 19/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. A murmur is heard on cardiac exam. The patient is treated appropriately and transferred to the inpatient floor and recovers over the next several days. The patient has been unable to eat solids, though he has been drinking large amounts of juice. On day 5 of his stay, the patient states he feels much better. He is no longer febrile. His only concern is profuse and watery diarrhea and severe abdominal pain which he has been experiencing since yesterday. The patient is started on IV fluids and given oral fluid replacement as well.
question: Which  is associated with the most likely underlying diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have profuse and watery diarrhea and severe abdominal pain since yesterday.
Have you had any fever or chills?
I was febrile before, but I am no longer febrile now.
Have you had any vomiting or nausea?
No, I haven't mentioned having vomiting or nausea.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to someone with a similar illness?
I haven't mentioned any recent travel or exposure to someone with a similar illness.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
I've been unable to eat solids and have been drinking large amounts of juice.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my weight or appetite.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or stress levels?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my sleep patterns or stress levels.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my medication or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
I haven't mentioned any recent changes in my family or medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Gastroenteritis.
